channel.title: üè¢ University of Massachusetts Amherst on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Massachusetts Amherst on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Attack-Resilient Image Watermarking Using Stable Diffusion
item.description: ZoDiac: a novel image watermarking framework leveraging pre-trained stable diffusion models for robust, invisible watermarks resistant to state-of-the-art attacks.

item.title: Fair and Welfare-Efficient Constrained Multi-Matchings under Uncertainty
item.description: This paper presents novel, scalable algorithms for fair and efficient constrained resource allocation under uncertainty using robust and CVaR optimization.

item.title: Gaussian Process Bandits for Top-k Recommendations
item.description: GP-TopK: A novel contextual bandit algorithm uses Gaussian processes with a Kendall kernel for efficient & accurate top-k recommendations, even with limited feedback.

item.title: Hamiltonian Monte Carlo Inference of Marginalized Linear Mixed-Effects Models
item.description: Accelerate Bayesian inference in linear mixed-effects models by efficiently marginalizing random effects using fast linear algebra, enabling faster and more accurate posterior estimations.

item.title: Learning Representations for Hierarchies with Minimal Support
item.description: Learn graph representations efficiently by identifying the minimal data needed to uniquely define a graph’s structure, achieving robust performance with fewer resources.

item.title: OSLO: One-Shot Label-Only Membership Inference Attacks
item.description: One-shot label-only attack (OSLO) achieves high membership inference accuracy with only one query, surpassing existing methods by a large margin.

item.title: Thinking Forward: Memory-Efficient Federated Finetuning of Language Models
item.description: SPRY: A memory-efficient federated learning algorithm for finetuning LLMs on resource-constrained devices, achieving high accuracy and speed.
